subsc: Agricultural extension and research,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial. Main lessons are suggested
            as follows. Fundamental to the success of the Agricultural
            Sector Management Project, was the implementation of
            macroeconomic reform programs in the first half of the 90s,
            critical for the implementation of the institutional
            reforms, and capacity building initiatives of the project,
            and its development objectives. Also critical, is the
            implementation of broad reform measures, demonstrated by
            either the presence, or lack thereof, of certain overarching
            institutional reforms, and guidelines, which both fostered,
            or hindered the progress of project activities,
            respectively. However, although the project succeeded in
            curtailing the Ministry of Agriculture's costs through
            retrenchment, and streamlining functions, the savings made
            did not result in returns to the Ministry, for neither
            increased operating costs, nor salaries were obtained, which
            was contrary to management expectations, and rather hindered
            an aggressive move in the reform process. Thus, as seen by
            the project outcome, a sustained long-term assistance that
            realizes the full benefit of institutional reform, is
            needed, through follow-up projects to carry forward the
            project initiatives.
